name: BBCWorld
text:
An estimated 1.3 billion tonnes of plastic is destined to pollute our lands and oceans by 2040 unless worldwide action is taken, scientists suggest

Researchers have been looking at the scale of our "plastic problem" over the next 20 years

[Thread]

https://t.co/kgmfG9Q2FU

name: BBCWorld
text:
"If you could imagine laying out all that plastic across a flat surface, it would cover the area of the UK 1.5 times‚Äù 

Leeds University's Dr Costas Velis says the figure is "staggering" but we have "the technology and the opportunity to stem the tide"

https://t.co/kgmfG9Q2FU https://t.co/q3kKqNX4be

name: BBCWorld
text:
Researchers tracked the global production and disposal of plastic then created a model to forecast future plastic pollution

The 1.3 billion estimate comes from current trends of increasing plastic production & assumes no significant changes in recycling

https://t.co/kgmfG9Q2FU https://t.co/jcuLceZtfN

name: BBCWorld
text:
Experts were able to project how different interventions could reduce plastic pollution

More recycling, reduced production and replacing plastic with other materials could reduce the amount of plastic going in the ocean by 2040 by 80%, modelling suggests

https://t.co/kgmfG9Q2FU https://t.co/doafFL0ibm

name: BBCWorld
text:
Steps experts are calling for include:

ü•§ reducing growth in plastic production
üßÉ substituting plastic with compostable materials
‚ôªÔ∏è designing recyclable packaging & products
üèóÔ∏è finding uses for the 23% of plastic that currently can't be recycled

https://t.co/kgmfG9Q2FU https://t.co/Ac9t4xaSlN

name: BBCWorld
text:
The report suggests there is no "silver bullet solution" for the plastic problem

It highlights an estimated 2 billion people in the Global South, who have no access to proper waste management

https://t.co/kgmfG9Q2FU https://t.co/N9ACCHLs9H

name: BBCWorld
text: Read more about the challenge we face to reduce plastic consumption by 2040: https://t.co/kgmfG9Q2FU
